citeinfo.title: Feature class CSAOrientationPoints, part of Metadata Template

descript.supplinf: Feature class CSAOrientationPoints is part of GeMS.gdb, a composite dataset that conforms to "GeMS (Geologic Map Schema)--a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps", available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/.

attracc.attraccr: Confidence that a feature exists and confidence that a feature is correctly identified are described in per-feature attributes ExistenceConfidence and IdentityConfidence.

horizpa.horizpar: Estimated accuracy of horizontal location is given on a per-feature basis by attribute LocationConfidenceMeters. Values are expected to be correct within a factor of 2. A LocationConfidenceMeters value of -9 or -9999 indicates that no value has been assigned.

enttyp.enttypd: Points that record the locations of structural data (e.g., bedding attitudes, foliation attitudes, slip vectors measured at a point, etc.) within the vertical plane defined by cross-section line [[X]]. Coordinates display features in cross-section view, i.e., units of the X-axis show length along the line of cross-section and units of the Y-axis show elevation.
enttyp.enttypds: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attrdomv.udom: Arbitrary string. Values should be unique within this database.

attr.attrdef: Strike or trend, measured in degrees clockwise from geographic North. Use right-hand rule (dip is to right of azimuth direction). Horizontal planar features may have any azimuth.
attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attr.attrdef: Dip or plunge, measured in degrees down from horizontal. Negative values allowed when specifying vectors (not axes) that point above the horizon, e.g., paleocurrents. Types defined as horizontal (e.g., horizontal bedding) shall have Inclination=0.
attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attr.attrdef: Reference to a point marker, line symbol, or area-fill symbol that is used on the map graphic to denote the feature: perhaps a star for a K-Ar age locality, or a heavy black line for a fault.
attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attr.attrdef: Plain-text equivalent of the desired annotation for a feature: for example "14 Ma", or "^c" which (when used with the FGDC GeoAge font) results in the geologic map-unit label TRc (with TR run together to make the Triassic symbol).
attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attr.attrdef: Estimated half-width in meters of positional uncertainty envelope; position is relative to other features in database.
attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attrdomv.udom: Positive real number. Value of -9, -99, or -999 indicates value is unknown.

attr.attrdef: Confidence that feature is correctly identified.
attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attr.attrdef: Estimated angular precision of combined azimuth AND inclination measurements, in degrees.
attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attrdomv.udom: Positive real number. Value of -9, -99, or -999 indicates value is unknown.

attr.attrdef: At what scale (or larger) should this observation or analysis be plotted? At smaller scales, it should not be plotted. Useful to prevent crowding of display at small scales and to display progressively more data at larger and larger scales. Value is scale denominator.
attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attr.attrdef: Short plain-text identifier of the map unit. Foreign key to DescriptionOfMapUnits table.
attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attr.attrdef: Source of location; foreign key to table DataSources.
attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attr.attrdef: Source of orientation data; foreign key to table DataSources.
attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attr.attrdef: Additional information specific to a particular feature or table entry.
attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attrdomv.udom: Unrepresentable domain. Free text. Values of <null> or #null indicate no entry.

attr.attrdefs: GeMS (Geologic Map Schema) - a standard format for the digital publication of geologic maps, available at http://ngmdb.usgs.gov/Info/standards/GeMS/

attrdomv.udom: Arbitrary string. Values should be unique within this database.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
